Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 49 for SLE 15 SP3)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 49 for SLE 15 SP3)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 5.3.18-150300_59_179 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2022-49025: net/mlx5e: Fix use-after-free when reverting termination table (bsc#1233023).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 15 SP3

Vulnerabilities.Description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

net/mlx5e: Fix use-after-free when reverting termination table

When having multiple dests with termination tables and second one
or afterwards fails the driver reverts usage of term tables but
doesn't reset the assignment in attr->dests[num_vport_dests].termtbl
which case a use-after-free when releasing the rule.
Fix by resetting the assignment of termtbl to null.
